column4: ok so I installed a program but it doesnt show up in application list where can I find it?
what program?
you installed rar from the repositories?
yeah, it's command line.  Try 'man rar'.  But the archive manager should now let you work with rar files
I get No manual entry for rar
hmm me too, guess /usr/share/doc/rar is what you will need to look into.  But isn't the archive manager letting you create and read rar files now?
well its opening up in ark
oh, archive manager is the gnome tool
I remeber a page in the ubuntu manual for explanation oof all the folders like etc bin media and all others what do I search for to find that?
not sure about the ubuntu manual but file:///usr/share/doc/debian-policy/fhs/fhs-2.3.html should give you lots of detail
If I want to run an application without going to application- internet-appname where can I find the "actual application"
well you can use the menu editor to see the path to the binary that the launcher is running
are most applications installed in "/usr/bin" I am talking about the "program files" foler link in windows
most user applications will get the binaries installed there afaik
ok so when I doubleclick an application in the usr/bin dir why isnt the executable running?
which application
xmms
its running

sorry for bothering you again and again :) I am trying to install opera browser I downloaded the deb file from their site but it says while installing it conflicts with package opera . I havent installed it before
thanks fo all the help
np
